natural problem: How many 5-digit numbers have at least one zero?
natural solution: A 5-digit number can have for its leftmost digit anything from 1 to 9 inclusive, and for each of its next four digits anything from 0 through 9 inclusive.

Thus there are $9\times 10\times 10\times 10\times 10=90,\!000$ 5-digit numbers. A 5-digit number with no zero as a digit can have for each of its five digits anything from 1 through 9 inclusive. There are $9\times 9\times 9\times 9\times 9=59,\!049$ such 5-digit numbers.
Therefore the number of 5-digit numbers with at least one zero as a digit is  $90,\!000-59,\!049=\boxed{30,951}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes count :: nat
assumes h0 : "count = card {n::nat. 10000 \<le> n \<and> n < 100000 \<and> (\<exists>k. n mod 10 ^ k = 0)}"
shows  "count = 30951"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 How many 5-digit numbers have at least one zero? The final Answer is 30,951
 ### Proof
 A 5-digit number can have for its leftmost digit anything from 1 to 9 inclusive, and for each of its next four digits anything from 0 through 9 inclusive.
 Thus there are $9\times 10\times 10\times 10\times 10=90,\!000$ 5-digit numbers. A 5-digit number with no zero as a digit can have for each of its five digits anything from 1 through 9 inclusive. There are $9\times 9\times 9\times 9\times 9=59,\!049$ such 5-digit numbers.
 Therefore the number of 5-digit numbers with at least one zero as a digit is  $90,\!000-59,\!049=\boxed{30,951}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes count :: nat
assumes h0 : "count = card {n::nat. 10000 \<le> n \<and> n < 100000 \<and> (\<exists>k. n mod 10 ^ k = 0)}"
shows  "count = 30951"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: How many natural numbers between 10,000 and 100,000 are divisible by some power of 10? The final answer is 30,951.

shows  "n = 30951"

fixes n :: nat
assumes h0 : "n \<ge> 10000"
and h1 : "n \<le> 99999"
and h2 : "\<forall>n. \<exists>k. n div (10^k) mod 10 = 0"
and h3 : "card {n. n \<ge> 10000 \<and> n \<le> 99999 \<and> (\<exists>k. n div (10^k) mod 10 = 0)} = m"
shows  "m = 30951"

 *)

 proof-
